results.title: Jet propulsion
results.brief_description: The film discusses the advances in aviation since the days of the Wright brothers and explains that the piston operated power unit imposes limits on the altitudes and speeds at which aircraft can fly. The basic principles of jet propulsion are outlined and the operation of a jet engine explained by means of animated diagrams. The advantages and disadvantages of jet engines are listed and different types of jet propulsion illustrated.

results.title: Jet pilot
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Joseph Koenig
results.brief_description: A film showing how the introduction of jet travel changed traditional ideas of space and time. The jet pilot in this film sped from northern cold to tropical heat in only a few hours. The film is a dramatic illustration of how high speed-travel shrinks the world and brings people together. An Air Canada plane is featured. (Award: Columbus)

results.title: Jet boats in New Zealand
results.brief_description: Jet boats found in various parts of New Zealand. A New Zealand inventor demonstrates his jet boats on the beautiful lake, Manapouri; water skiers skim behind jet boats in Lyttelton Harbour; the twin jet ‘Rangimarie’ takes tourists up the Wanganui River and jet-boaters shoot the rapids and shallows of the Waimakariri River.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description: This is a special catechetical edition of Zeffirelli’s film, divided into 14 distinct parts, running for a total time of 7 hours. Starring Robert Powell as Jesus Christ, Peter Ustinov as Herod, Olivia Hussey as the Virgin Mary, Michael York as John the Baptist, Anne Bancroft as Mary Magdelene, and James Farentino as the Apostle Peter, this is the tale of the life and death of Jesus Christ, from the time of his birth until his crucifixion.

results.title: Jesus of Nazareth
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, ITC, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: Director Franco Zeffirelli’s powerful and compelling epic traces the life of Jesus of Nazareth from Immaculate Conception through to Divine Resurrection. Critically acclaimed and lauded by religious leaders worldwide, a distinguished cast supports Robert Powell and Olivia Hussey in the leading roles of Jesus and Mary.

results.title: Jesus of Montreal
results.creator_credit: Max Films, ONF | NFB, Roger Frappier, Pierre Gendron and Denys Arcand
results.brief_description: Daniel is a young actor who, like most of his friends, flits from commercials to stage to television trying to find work. Asked to take on a production of the Passion for a local Church, he finds himself increasingly obsessed with the story of Jesus and his redemption on the Cross. Daniel and the young cast begin to create a retelling of the Passion which resonates with a contemporary audience. However, the radical reworking upsets both the Church and the commercial sponsors who are uncomfortable with the interpretation. “Jesus of Montreal” is a sublime and deeply spiritual film. It is to director Denys Arcand’s credit that he has not only made a film that is ravishing to look at and experience but one which is not afraid to ask the big, difficult questions about life, faith and meaning. Winner of the Jury Prize at the Cannes Film Festival. Winner of a Silver Bear at the Berlin Film Festival.

results.title: Jesus Christ superstar (2000)
results.creator_credit: Really Useful Films and Gale Edwards
results.brief_description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice’s rock opera, “Jesus Christ Superstar” is one of the most successful theatrical musicals of all time. The story of Jesus’ Passion is scored to a vibrant, electronic rock beat and is performed by a cast of dancers and singers. This version, following on from Norman Jewison’ 1973 feature film of the same name, is primarily the filming of a stage production, performed in London, 1996-2000. The accent has shifted and stress is now placed on the perspective of Judas, casting him as a man in conflict with Jesus over the direction the cause has taken. Modernisation of the sets and costumes is reflected in the multicultural cast that are dressed in modern garb - including techno gear and Darth Veda-ish masks. The songs however remain the same and it is through their singing that the full tragedy and power of the Passion is realised. Songs include” “Jesus Christ Superstar”, “What’s the Buzz” and “I Don’t Know How to Love Him.” Cast includes Glenn Carter, Jerome Pradon, Renee Castle, Fred Johanson, Rik Mayall, Frederick B. Owens, Michael Shaeffer.

results.title: Jesus Christ superstar
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Norman Jewison and Robert Stigwood
results.brief_description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice’s rock opera, “Jesus Christ Superstar” is one of the most successful theatrical musicals of all time. The story of Jesus’s Passion is scored to a vibrant, electronic rock beat and is performed by a cast of dancers and singers. The tribal aesthetics of the hippies and the counter-culture are as integral to the work as is the story of the Gospels. Filmed on location in Israel, the movie version of the opera is a pyrotechnic feast with dazzling editing and photography. Finally, however, it is the strength of the music and libretto by which this work has to be judged. The performances of Yvonne Elliman as Mary Magdalene and Carl Anderson as Judas are outstanding. Through their singing, the full tragedy and power of the Passion is realised. Songs include” “Jesus Christ Superstar”, “What’s the Buzz” and a knockout rendition of “I Don’t Know How to Love Him” by Elliman. Melvyn Bragg co-wrote the screenplay with Norman Jewison.

results.title: Jesus' son [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, Blue Sky Studios, Evenstar, Elizabeth Cutherell, Lydia Dean Pilcher, David Urrutial, Margot Bridger and Alison MacLean
results.brief_description: Based on Denis Johnson’s acclaimed gritty short story collection, also called “Jesus’ Son”, this a finely observed drama about a young man’s descent into heroin abuse and small-time criminality in the early seventies. Faithfully recreating the drug subculture of the time, and also utilising a loose narrative structure and mise-en-scene that recalls the daring independent work of early 1970s American cinema, “Jesus’ Son” features a rich array of characters who are by turn tragic and comic. Billy Crudup and Samantha Morton are excellent as two young lovers working out their shared dependency on each other and on heroin, and they are well supported by a supporting cast that includes Holly Hunter, Denis Leary and Dennis Hopper. Though the material is harsh and confronting, “Jesus’ Son” also emerges as a deeply optimistic and humane drama. This is an excellent example of a film work that remains true to the mood and emotional intensity of its original source text, but which also creatively re-imagines and develops the story for another medium.

results.title: Jessye Norman: Singer
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain, BBC-TV, Harvey Kass and Cathy Palmer
results.brief_description: The full range and diversity of Jessye Norman’s singing is captured on film at performances in London, Paris and New York. Examples of these performances shown are the role of Ariadne in Strauss’ Ariadne auf Naxos, and the lament from Purcell’s Dido and Aeneas. Jessye also comments on her cultural roots and evolution as a singer.
